settings.custom_liquid:
Siluet has partnered with Flex to allow qualified customers to use their HSA or FSA funds to purchase qualified products

This means you may be able to use your HSA or FSA debit card to buy our products with pre-tax dollars, resulting in net savings of 30–40%.

*on qualified products for qualified customers

How Does It Work?

  1. 1

    Add product(s) to your cart.

  2. 2

    Select “Flex” payment option at checkout.

  3. 3

    Confirm your eligibility by answering a brief telehealth survey.

  4. 4

    Enter your FSA/HSA card information and press submit.
View full details

settings.text:
To use your HSA or FSA debit card, add products to your cart as usual. At checkout, select Flex | Pay with HSA/FSA as your payment option, confirm your eligibility, and enter your HSA or FSA debit card.

Complete your checkout as usual. If you don’t have your HSA or FSA card handy, you can enter your credit card information, and Flex will email you an itemized receipt to submit for reimbursement.

text_4txpdD.name: What is an FSA or HSA and what are the benefits?

settings.title: What is an FSA or HSA and what are the benefits?
settings.content: Health Savings Accounts (HSAs) and Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs) offer tax advantages for health-related expenses. The key difference is ownership—FSAs are employer-owned and typically “use it or lose it,” meaning unused funds expire yearly. HSAs, however, are individually owned, staying with you through job changes and allowing self-employed individuals to open one. Unlike FSAs, HSA funds can be invested and grow tax-free over time, making them a flexible long-term option for managing healthcare costs.

text_FYTCJP.name: How can I spend my FSA or HSA funds at Siluet?

settings.title: How can I spend my FSA or HSA funds at Siluet?
settings.content:
It’s common practice for HSA and FSA providers to send you a debit card that you can use to purchase eligible items. Both FSAs and HSAs are acceptable online and in physical stores.

You can also pay for health expenses with your regular credit or debit card, collect receipts, and submit to your HSA or FSA provider to be reimbursed.

text_i6bbaW.name: I'm not seeing HSA or FSA options show up at checkout. Why not?

settings.title: I'm not seeing HSA or FSA options show up at checkout. Why not?
settings.content:
If HSA/FSA payment options aren’t appearing at checkout, it could be due to:

  • Product Eligibility – Only certain health-related items qualify for HSA/FSA use. Check if your purchase meets the requirements.
  • Shop Pay Auto-Selection – If Shop Pay is enabled, it may prevent HSA/FSA options from appearing. Try checking out as a guest.
  • Insufficient Funds – If your HSA/FSA balance is too low, the transaction may not process.

If you’re still having trouble, check with your HSA/FSA provider for assistance.

settings.title: I keep being pushed into Shop Pay. How do I use my HSA/FSA card?
settings.content:
Shop Pay may not always support HSA/FSA cards directly. To use your HSA/FSA card, try these steps:

  • Select a Different Payment Method – At checkout, look for an option to enter your card details manually instead of using Shop Pay.
  • Disable Shop Pay – If Shop Pay is auto-selecting, you may need to opt out or choose “Checkout as Guest.”
  • Check Eligibility – Ensure the item qualifies for HSA/FSA purchases, as ineligible items may prevent the card from being accepted.

If you still have issues, contact your HSA/FSA provider for assistance.

settings.title: What is a qualified customer?
settings.content: A qualified customer for HSA (Health Savings Account) or FSA (Flexible Spending Account) products is someone who meets the eligibility requirements for these accounts and currently has an HSA or FSA account.

text_P7mijM.name: How do I confirm eligibility when checking out?

settings.title: How do I confirm eligibility when checking out?
settings.content: Upon checking out, select “Flex” as your payment option.  You will then be prompted to answer a brief telehealth survey regarding your HSA/FSA-approved condition. In a few hours, you’ll receive a Letter of Medical Necessity, which can then be submitted to your administrator for reimbursement if you choose to pay with a regular credit or debit card.

text_zpE3gE.name: Why do I need to provide my health information?

settings.title: Why do I need to provide my health information?
settings.content: To use your HSA or FSA card for a qualified product, the IRS requires a Letter of Medical Necessity. Siluet has partnered with Flex to offer asynchronous telehealth visits during checkout. Within 24 hours of your purchase, Flex will email you an itemized receipt.

text_FG6tEw.name: Help! I mistakenly entered my name and/or date of birth incorrectly.

settings.title: Help! I mistakenly entered my name and/or date of birth incorrectly.
settings.content: Please email support@withflex.com, and they will reach out to their telehealth team to reprocess and send your corrected Letter of Medical Necessity.

text_8TgGgM.name: I did not receive an itemized receipt and/or Letter of Medical Necessity

settings.title: I did not receive an itemized receipt and/or Letter of Medical Necessity
settings.content: Please check your spam folder, as emails from notifications@withflex.com may sometimes be filtered as spam by certain email providers. If you still can’t find it, please contact support@withflex.com and provide the email address associated with your order.

text_MaWNha.name: What if I do not have my HSA/FSA card on hand?

settings.title: What if I do not have my HSA/FSA card on hand?
settings.content: If you don’t have your HSA or FSA card available, still choose “Flex | Pay with HSA/FSA” as your payment method. Enter your credit card information, and Flex will email you an itemized receipt for reimbursement submission.

text_NKzRBN.name: Is sales tax covered by HSA/FSA funds, or is it treated separately?

settings.title: Is sales tax covered by HSA/FSA funds, or is it treated separately?
settings.content: Sales tax for eligible items is also covered by HSA/FSA funds. If the customer has a split cart, the tax will be allocated across the cards based on the items.
